intro: Psychotria gracilis, commonly known as the slender psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Psychotria gracilis is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
